Rypdal has collaborated both as a guitarist and as a [MASK] with other ECM artists such as Ketil Bjørnstad and David Darling.

He later joined renowned bandoneonist and nuevo tango [MASK] Ástor Piazzolla in his sextet, and later worked with Jorge Anders, Rodolfo Mederos, Dino Saluzzi, Roberto Pettinato, and Karlheinz Miklin, among others.
Ojos Negros is an album by Argentine bandoneon player and [MASK] Dino Saluzzi with cellist Anja Lechner recorded in 2006 and released on the ECM label.
El Encuentro is a live album by Argentine bandoneon player and [MASK] Dino Saluzzi with cellist Anja Lechner and The Metropole Orchestra recorded in 2009 and released on the ECM label.
Once Upon a Time – Far Away in the South is an album by Argentine bandoneón player and [MASK] Dino Saluzzi recorded in 1985 and released on the ECM label.
Navidad de Los Andes is an album by Argentine bandoneon player and [MASK] Dino Saluzzi with cellist Anja Lechner and saxophonist Felix Saluzzi recorded in 2010 and released on the ECM label.
Andina is a solo album by Argentine bandoneón player and [MASK] Dino Saluzzi recorded in 1988 and released on the ECM label.
Christian Heinrich Arthur Drews ([dʀɛfs]; November 1, 1865 – July 19, 1935) was a German writer, historian, [MASK], and important representative of German monist thought.

Phong Bui (born September 17, 1964, in Huế, Vietnam) is an artist, writer, independent [MASK], and Co-Founder, Editor-in-Chief, and Publisher of The Brooklyn Rail, a free monthly arts, culture, and politics journal.

Marian Hemar (1901–1972), born Marian Hescheles, also Jan Mariański, Marian Wallenrod, was a Polish poet, journalist, [MASK], comedy writer, and songwriter: he himself said that before the outbreak of World War II he had written 1200 songs including hits like Może kiedyś innym razem (Maybe Some Other Time) and Upić się warto (Let's get drunk).
